NIPALS¶

Nonlinear iterative partial least squares [REFERENCE HERE].

NIPALS.nipals.nipals(someotherinputsidontknowyet, version='sample')¶

Orthogonal weights: \(W^T_q W_q = I_q\)

Envelope connection: \(\mathrm{span}(Wq) = \mathcal{E}_{Σ_X}(\mathcal{B})\), the \(Σ_X\)-envelope of \(\mathcal{B} \mathrel{\vcenter{:}}= \mathrm{span}(\beta)\).

Score matrix \(S_d\): These are traditional computational intermediaries, although they are not needed in the computation of \(\hat{\beta}_{\mathrm{npls}}\).

Algorithm \(\mathbb{N}\): This is an instance of Algorithm N discussed in §1.5.3. PLS1 v. PLS2 Algorithm is applicable for PLS1 or PLS2 fits; See §3.8.
